Extra crowdfunding offer: Bamboo socks
Exclusively for our Indiegogo funders: Sizable super soft Bamboo socks.
True love is like a pair of socks: you gotta have two and they've gotta match. We will provide bamboo socks in black or navy blue color. Available in size 39-42 and 43-46.






Pick-up party!
Instead of receiving your products by mail (and pay for shipping costs), we invite you to raise a glass with us and receive your order, directly after the crowd funding campaign. On the 15th of May, you will be one of our honored guests at the unforgettable Sizable launch event, near Brussels.
In case you cannot join us, you can alternatively add an optional 5 EUR (or 15 EUR for international shipping) shipping cost in the Additional Gift category.

   The Impact 
Sizable produces all of their products in a responsible way, with respect to the highest standards of quality & sustainability.  At Sizable, we use superior bamboo, a natural fabric with minimal impact on the environment.

  
Other Ways You Can Help Sizable already contracted several stores in Belgium, but our ambition is to sell worldwide!  If one of your friends hasn't discovered Sizable - Invisible Undershirts yet, please help him and give him the confidence and style he deserves. Support us by spreading the word and help us achieve our ambitions!



FAQ
How do I choose my model, size and color (for the socks)?

At the end of our campaign (14th of May), we will send you a link where you can choose model, size and color. 
How can I order your products on this site?

Please select the perk and do the checkout. You can pay by paypal or credit card. We can help you with the order and payment handling, just send an e-mail to sales [at] sizable.eu.


How do I account for shipping costs (Belgium/The Netherlands)?

Please add an optional 5 EUR in the Additional Gift category.
Does Sizable ship internationally? 
Yes we do! Please add 15 EUR to your order for European shipping or 30 EUR for international shipping. This can be paid by paypal.


A Special Thank You!
We want to thank each and everyone who supported us in our fantastic journey so far. A special thanks goes to: Julien Mannenmode (Puurs), Barramundo (Mechelen), our models and actors, the team of photographers and camera crew, our make-up artist and all the family and friends.

Meet the team!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Ethan Abitz and I am the CEO and Founder of American Coastal Apparel. I started this company about two years ago while I was a senior in high school and have since been working every day to try and improve it. However, I have not been alone in this; my business partner, Riley Brown, is an absolute necessity to our team and without him, we would not be where we are today. 

With this campaign we are working to make American Coastal Apparel a fully self-sufficient company, being able to make our own products and customize our apparel in any way that our customers would like. We want to be able to have a customer come to us with a special design that they have in mind, and put it on a piece of apparel for them, without charging them half of a fortune. Building relationships with our customers has always been a priority of ours, starting back when we were selling my t-shirts out of the back of our cars. My crew and I have worked continuously to grow and expand our brand, and have taken it from having only one color t-shirt with one logo to having multiple different products with numerous designs and color patterns! However, without having our own machines, we are still limited in what products we can offer. If we were to get funded and buy our own machines, we would have full freedom to design our products in whatever way we, or our customers could want.

 

What We Need & What It's For

-In order to become fully self-sufficient, we need to raise $15,000

This money will cover the cost of:

An embroidery machine- $6,499

A silk-screen printer- $1,599 

A direct to garment printer- $2,000

A heat press- $1,000

Materials/extras for each of these- $3,000

 

If we do not meet our funding goal, the money will be spent on the equipment that we can afford with what we raised. We will continuously work to try and fund this project as it is the next step that this company needs to take in order to make our customers the happiest that they can be.

 

The Impact

Our campaign is focused around our values of customer relationships and the sense of being able to express oneself. We want our customers to be able to come to us with a specific design or logo idea in their minds and talk to us about it so that we can make it a reality. People love to express themselves through whichever way they can, and we want to help our customers achieve this, but the only way that we can fully do that is by owning our own equipment and making our products ourselves.

But wait, doesn’t that mean more work for you?

Well yes, it does. Instead of having a manufacturer create our products for us and print our designs we would be printing and embroidering our designs onto our products ourselves. This way we have complete freedom with how we want our products to look. We can then put our focus on working with our customers to design shirts exactly how they picture them in their minds.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This isn’t a fairy tale, it’s real life and obviously there are risks involved. We may not get fully funded and are rendered incapable of buying all the equipment that we need, but that’s okay. We will persevere. Our first order of t-shirts turned this hideous color of yellow after two or three washes so we had a lot of damage control to do as we were just starting out – but we persevered, and now we are here.

If we are unable to fund the full amount that we are asking for, then we will not be able to buy all the equipment, however we will hopefully be able to purchase at least one or two pieces of machinery, which is still a step in the right direction. We are certain that we will get all of the equipment that we need, however if we don’t get fully funded it may just take a bit longer than we anticipated.

We aren’t strangers to not having as much funding as we’d like, we started the company with only $500 and have since built it up from there. We are used to making things work, as we will do whatever is necessary to see this company excel.

If we do not get fully funded we will surely be working just as hard to sell more products, build more relationships with our customers, strengthen our brand, and ultimately save up our money until we have enough to invest in the rest of the machinery that we need.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

- No Money, No Problem

We understand and relate to the fact that donating is not possible for everyone – we are broke college students, so we know what it’s like.

If you are unable to donate we ask that you help to spread the word about our campaign! There is no such thing as too much awareness! Tell your co-worker, tell your boss, tell your local barista! There is no limit to the amount of people you could tell. Every person you tell helps us and we truly appreciate every little bit. Don’t forget about the Indiegogo share tools either!

Thank you again for taking the time to view our campaign.

story:
TOTTI THE TOTE

This mid-size tote is an elegant mid-size tote bag hand made with genuine leather and hand screen printed heavy natural canvas. Totti is designed with a lot of thoughts into usability and has much needed compartments needed by the ladies for their necessities. It has also a zip compartment for your more important things that you want to keep more secured.

Materials

  • hand screen printed heavy natural cotton canvas
  • genuine smooth leather trimmings and straps

Functions

  • 2 interior slot compartments
  • 1 zip compartment

Dimensions

CHEERIO BAG   

Cheerio bag is an utilitarian bag that we simply love to use for everyday. It is beautifully shaped and yet large enough to carry your iPad pro and up to a 13 inch laptop. Again everything is hand made from the print on the fabric to the making of the bag. Basically no expense is spared in ensuring we get a great quality bag. This bag is a bag that will cheer you up with highly functional interior that will help you segregate your stuff into different compartments for easy access.

Materials

  • hand screen printed heavy natural cotton canvas
  • genuine smooth leather trimmings and straps

Functions

  • 1 large slot compartment for bigger stuff
  • 3 side compartments for smaller stuff
  • 1 zip compartment for more secure stuff

Dimensions

SMILEY THE CLUTCH

Smiley is a simple classy clutch whose shape looks like a smile. It's small enough to be easily carried. It has wrist strap allows it to easily hang from your hand. Inside, there is a zip compartment for you to keep more secure stuff and enough space for you to keep a long wallet and some small necessities. Smiley is so easy to carry that you can carry at all occasion and with a clip wrist strap, you can easily hook it onto any of your bag.

Materials

  • hand screen printed heavy natural cotton canvas
  • genuine smooth leather trimmings and straps

Functions

  • 1 zip compartment

Dimensions

REGAMI

Regami is a long wallet design derived from Japanese origami. As can be seen in its interior. Regami has beautiful criss-cross compartment design which is actually really hard to make by hand. We have added invisible magnetic closures to help keep the interior of the wallet clean and not to disturb the beautiful design inside.

Materials

  • hand screen printed heavy natural cotton canvas
  • genuine smooth leather trimmings

Functions

  • 20 interior slot compartments
  • 1 zip compartment

Dimensions

TRIXX COIN POUCH 

Trixx is a three dimensional coin pouch with a suede interior. It is made with high quality hand printed thick cotton canvas with natural leather trimmings.

Materials

  • hand screen printed heavy natural cotton canvas
  • genuine smooth leather trimmings

Functions

  • 1 zip compartment

Dimensions

  • 3rd July - Campaign begins
  • End August - Campaign Ends And Send out Surveys
  • 15th September - Order Materials
  • 1st Week of November - Start Production
  • End of December to Mid January - Complete Production
  • End of January - Start packing and shipping out

Every items come with a one (1) year limited warranty. The warranty covers fault(s) in construction and workmanship only. 

Please note that the fabric and leather might fade and evolve with time.

story:
About Us:

Green Matters Apparel Company is dedicated to sustainability and the customer. We believe that fashionable and sustainable apparel does not have to be ridiculously priced, and can be provided for similar prices to the unsustainable products already on the market. We plan to start off small and master the basic tee, then move on to creating other products to expand our apparel line. Before we do that, we want to see if you care. By donating $30, you will receive one of the t-shirts below.
 

The Impact:

Clothing production is not commonly tied to water pollution, but the fact of the matter is that 20% of the world's water pollution comes from the textile industry. That is an unsettling number considering all of the other industries in the world. By purchasing our t-shirt over traditional t-shirts made with synthetic dyes, you are directly reducing the amount of harmful chemicals used for clothing production. Join us as we strive to create sustainable apparel that is not only good for the environment, but also fashionable and affordable for you. 


Our Team:
Winona Quigley:

Winona is a senior at Parsons, The New School for Design located in New York City. She learned the importance of sustainability in everyday life, and was inspired to use her passion of fashion and design for the greater good. Winona has spent countless hours practicing and experimenting with different natural dyeing techniques on a hemp, cotton, silk, wool, and polyester. She is the expert behind the t-shirt. 

Tyler Stoltzfus (the guy in the video):
Tyler is a senior at the Fox School of Business in the entrepreneurship program.  He is responsible for the business side of Green Matters Apparel Company. Tyler submitted the idea in Temple's Innovative Idea Competition in Fall 2015 and received First Place.

Jacob Andrews:
Jacob is an Entrepreneurship and Economics major at Temple. Jacob grew up around fashion and sustainable practices and finds it important for everyone to minimize their impact and do what they can to live a sustainable life. He has been a real help behind the scenes with crunching numbers and conducting research. Jacob will be graduating in 2018 and will officially join the team when finished school.

Our Greenhouse:
This past summer we built a greenhouse for growing the plant materials needed for our dyes. We grew our first yield of marigolds this past winter. Take a look at some pictures from start to finish.



Where does the money go?
The money you donate will go straight into production. We are not looking to raise money, but simply gauge the interest of you, the consumer. We are convinced this is a great idea, but ultimately, the decision is up to you. The concept is simple. For every contribution of $30, you receive one of our t-shirts. You can specify what cut, color, and size you would like. We will make the t-shirts this summer (2016) and have them to you no later than August 31, 2016. 

DETAILS FOR ORDERING:
When you contribute $30, send an email to greenmattersapparelco@gmail.com and specify which of the 3 colors you would like (Iron Green, Marigold, Madder), size, and cut (women's/men's). Make sure you DO NOT select anonymous. We need to be able to link your email to the actual contribution. 

*There may be slight variances in the actual color compared to colors above


Challenges:
Just like with any other new venture, there are always unforeseen challenges when turning an idea into a functioning business. First of all, we have to see if what we are selling is actually a product you desire. Also, we have not produced our t-shirts on a large scale, so there is bound to be challenges in actual production. We are giving ourselves the summer to work out the bugs. Let's say you order a t-shirt in June. We may mess up once or twice in fulfilling your order, but we will have your t-shirt to you by August 31st which will give us plenty of time to fix our mistakes.

Other Ways You Can Help:
You may not have $30 to spend on a t-shirt, but you do have a voice. If this is a product you believe in, you can help us by donating in any way you can and also spreading the word! Let your friends and family know what we are doing and don't be afraid to share us on Facebook.

story: Fundraising completed. Thank you!

story:
OUR STORY 

Built on the dream to make fine shave creams, shave balms, lotions, and quality razors and brushes, Cardinham | Killigrew blends old-world design and modern engineering. 

Fine formulas provide an amazing experience with every butter and oil hand picked for exceptional quality and designed to exceed the worlds finest brands.  Our company wishes you to indulge in amazing products that are presented in classic packaging that makes you think of London or Paris at the turn of the century.  We have created a line of classic shave kits, shave supplies, and heavy duty razors that are a treat to use. 

Modern Engineering : Old-World Design

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our growth has been amazing and our reviews over the top, but we need help to grow!  So, we are offering many of our products to you at a discounts in exchange for slower processing time.  We are a Delaware USA based company and we make all out kits, balms, creams, and oils right here in the USA.  Please take the time and support American small business. - MADE WITH PRIDE IN AMERICA!

WE ASK!  Please, if you like our products and our story, please take a second and post our link and story to your Facebook and twitter accounts!  We are a small American Business trying to grow and we need your help!  We can succeed if you help; each of you has the power to help promote Cardinham | Killigrew

American Made Artisan Quality - Support Artisans - Share the Link

 

 

Our Products

The Classic Shave Set:  Our cornerstone product!  This beautiful set is stained, painted, and lined by hand in our studio and filled with amazing products!  Razor, Boar hair brush, shave bowl, cream, and balm.  This scent features our herbal and clean Green Tea & Lavender fragrance and herringbone lining.

 

 

The Vintage Shave Set:  This beautiful set is stained, painted, and lined by hand in our studio and filled with amazing products!  Heavy Weight VISCOUNT Razor, Boar hair brush, shave bowl, The HUNT Cologne, cream, and balm.  All is our most popular The Hunt fragrance with hounds tooth lining.  You can even add a monogram!

 

 

 

  The Bulldog Razor: Short, stubby, and heavy, the Bulldog is an amazing razor!

 

 

 

The DUKE Razor: Our classic, chrome plated masterpiece!  This razor is heavy and beautiful.

 

 

The Killigrew Shave Brush: Hand-Turned in Delaware, Black Palm and Badger Hair! And to top it off?  The hilt is imbued with an English Half Crown Coin!

 

The Hunt Cologne:

Our most popular scent!  Think an early morning hunt in the English countryside...

 

 

 

 

 

The Refill Pack: Refill pack features Shave Cream, Shave Balm, Shave Oil, and Blade - About a 3 month supply!  In The Hunt or Dark OakFragrance!

 

www.cardinhamkilligrew.com

Please LIKE our Facebook Page and Share to YOUR Wall!

www.facebook.com\cardinham

 

Supported by our Cardinham | Killigrew YOUTUBE CHANNEL: 

"The Modern Man's Guide to being and Old-World Gentleman"

story:
Allow me to introduce myself. I am Latif Yahia, known for my book and the movie of my life 'The Devil's Double'

From an early age, I was always interested in fashion and design. I was blessed with drawing skills and, when living in the West, began to design my own clothing which I've worn for all my media appearances and red carpet movie premieres.
Since the movie's release, I have been involved in politics but now wish to concentrate on my own brand of men's and Ladies clothing and accessories including gold and diamond wristwatches.
What is required is a flagship designer store to showcase my designer collection. Suitable premises have been found in Paris but €150,000 as deposit is needed to open the store.
This is your chance to invest in me and my brand. If the style of clothes and wristwatches I have designed are your style, then join me in my venture.
Various incentives are on offer:
There will be an annual fashion show which I will host and to which all investors will be invited. I look forward to welcoming you.

I will donate 20% of the profits from my work to people  diagnosed with multiple sclerosis after i been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis before 4 years ago, and I will donate 20% of the profits from my work To orphans of wars around the world After losing my daughter a few months ago.

Many designers have written about the inspiration behind their designs or signature style, I believe that your style should enhance your personality, be practical, comfortable and most of all yours.
style is not only about what clothes you buy, but more so about how you wear them.
to be comfortable in your skin and your suit is to be confident and so I share with you my signature style,
make it your own.
Latif Yahia

story:
What we're trying to do...

The aim of our project is to prove the practicality of replacing ski resorts' conventional one-time-use wasteful paper trail maps with the eco-friendly, recyclable and reusable NaviSki.

Our goal and how the funds will be used...

Our goal is to provide enough NaviSkis to between three and five ski resorts next winter as a pilot project demonstrating how the resorts can cost-effectively further their efforts to go green!

The funds will be used on a three tiered basis. The first use will go toward the printing, folding and mounting of sample maps like the one below.

The second tier use will allow us to attend the National Ski Areas Association trade show in early May where we will present the concept to ski resort owners and general managers. The final tier funds will go for the purpose of offseting the cost of tooling and producing multi-cavity injection molds for the housing unit to replace our current single-cavity mold, which would include specialized insert plates to create resort-specific logos for the face of the housing.

Using the latest high tech materials, NaviSki is our decidedly low tech solution to the problems of both paper waste (more on that below) and the inconvenience of the current road-map style of ski map now in use. It's not a sexy new app, but we think it's kinda cool, super convenient and so easy on the environment! With the exception of the elastic band, every element of Naviski is made of recyclable plastic. Even the "paper" is environmentally friendly produced plastic; and you can read more about that further down as well.

Okay, so we've had some fun demonstrating the convenience of NaviSki in the video, and while we think this is a pretty deft solution to all of our clumsy map problems, we also have our eye on a far bigger and more important issue.

That large, folded-up paper trail map that the resort ever so kindly gave you when you purchased your lift ticket comes with a serious environmental price. Not their fault. It was what it was. But consider the numbers for a minute. Each one of those maps is roughly the size of four, 8.5 by 11 inch sheets of paper. With over 300 ski resorts in the United States hosting around 16 million skiers and snow boarders who purchase over 60 million lift tickets, that's a lot of paper, not to mention ink, which, at the end of the day, ends up in the garbage... which ends up in landfills, or sometimes, the maps wind up flying around the mountain as twirling trash twisting in the wind. So just how much paper is that? With upwards of 10 million maps printed up each year and with paper being 0.004 inches in thickness, that amounts to quite a hill of beans. Sorry not a hill... but a mountain. In fact, it's pretty close to a stack of paper over thirteen thousand, two hundred feet tall. So if you were standing on the peak of East Wall at Arapahoe Basin Ski Resort, at thirteen thousand fifty feet, you would have to look up to see the top of that stack of paper.

The pre-assembled components of NaviSki...

 

Part of the funds will go toward producing a multi-rack perforation die larger than our homemade prototype that you see here, for cutting the maps into their uniquely foldable shape, below.

 

The artwork for the maps is already completed but the printing, perforating and mounting within the housings must be executed as well.

To achieve the best possible cost effectiveness, minimum order quantities from the manufacturer are necessary to secure the lowest available per unit price. That low cost will be passed along to the resort in order to remain competitive with the current conventional maps. It's important to remember that because of its reusability, the number of NaviSkis in use at a resort will be far smaller than the quantity of paper maps needed to service the same number of skiers. And that will reduce even further, the resort's expenditure for their maps. That speaks to their bottom line as well as their desire to be environmentally friendly. All we ask of our fellow skiers and riders is that they drop 'em in a convenient barrel on their way out for reuse the next day.

We want to emphasize here that in order to both lessen our environmental footprint by eliminating unnecessary transportation and fuel consumption and provide as many jobs as we possibly can in the local economy, NaviSki will be made entirely in America.

If we prove successful, we can then embark on an effort to expand the use of NaviSki industry-wide and finally eliminate that mountain of paperwork we outlined above. With your help, that goal can be achieved and we will have done our small part to improve life on this lovely blue planet of ours.

To show our appreciation, your rewards...

Our Bumper Sticker

 

Our NaviSki Tee Shirt

Our Backpack

 

OKAY A LITTLE TECHNICAL STUFF:

For the "paper" maps we use a 100% tree and pulp-free synthetic paper, which results in conservation of forests, water and natural resources.

  • No ozone-threatening emissions result from the synthetic paper's manufacturing process.
  • The manufacturing facility in Chesapeake, Virginia has been recognized for excellence in the handling and discharge of waste water.
  • Crafted of tree-free polypropylene pellets, the "paper" is 100% recyclable.
  • Using the recommended methods, the recycling of the synthetic paper generates no sulfur, nitrogen or dioxin gases.
  • Internal processes are continually reviewed at every stage to maximize environmental stewardship and minimize our carbon footprint.
  • Very little water is used in the creation of the paper, which results in the preservation of Earth's water resources.
  • The paper's durability and attributes yield a map that will have extremely long wear and stay out of the waste stream longer.
  • Trim created during the manufacturing process is recycled and reintroduced in the production of further maps.
  • The pulp-free, tree-free synthetic paper is free of toxins and heavy metals, producing yet another environmental benefit.

There you have it. Thank you for taking the time to give us a look-see. Here's hoping that together, we can prove the feasibility of replacing paper maps with recycled plastic to help conserve our resources... one NaviSki at a time!

List of Available Resorts:

Alta, Big Sky/Moonlight Basin, Breckenridge, Cannon Mountain, Canyons, Deer Valley, Heavenly, Jackson Hole, Killington, Lake Placid, Loon Mountain, Mammoth Mountain, Okemo, Park City, Snowbird, Snowmass, Stowe, Sugarbush, Sugarloaf, Sun Valley, Taos, Telluride, Timberline, Vail

Who am I?

My name is Jerry Brancato, I am an Army vet and I have been working on the technical side of the entertainment industry for the last 15 years as an industrial engineer designing and building teleprompter equipment and workstations for clients and shows such as the Emmy Awards, American Idol, Dancing With The Stars, MTV and the Fox Network. I'm only a fella with an idea trying to help improve the planet in my own small way. I just can't do something of this scale quite on my own. I've put thousands of my own dollars into the project thus far but I need your help to keep going so that I, and all of us together, can make a difference.

I've put thousands of my own dollars into the project thus far but I need your help to keep going so that I, and all of us together, can make a difference.

story:
• Designed to restrict small children and aging seniors that need care, from turning on a faucet handle,

  • Helps prevent water accidents, including :

  • Burns

  • Drowning

  • Flooding caused by water over-flow


Restraint accommodates standard 4" and 8" faucet handles


Zip Strip connector & Locking Mechanism

        Easily adjust to tighten in seconds.  Similar to a zip tie, the strip      connects each cuff which prevents the handles usage until removed

Quick Release Trigger

Makes removal easy for adults.  Squeeze tab inward and pull off to remove.  To replace on handle simply slide and adjust to fit

         


Attaches and Removes in just seconds

*** Patent Pending Design *** 

See below for more detail about fitting sizes  and product specs

Short Summary

Faucet Handle Safety Restraints is a"Faucetlock" that guards against small children and aging seniors with special needs from accessing water from bathroom faucets and accidentally scalding themselves and can prevent them accessing water by some  bathtub faucets (depending on the style handle).

About Us:

  • My name is Larry Holmes, a father of 2 young boys and a Senior Product Designer with over fifteen  years of solid expertise in developing safe, innovative, and consumer items.
  • There are no safety items that prevent small children from accessing water in home bathrooms.  65% of scald burns happen to young children are due to exposure to tap water from sinks and tubs in our homes.
  • Since starting the development of the safety restraints I am constantly connecting with parents, care-givers, pre-K educators and doctors that share with me encounters that they too have had with their juveniles and water burns.


How It All Began...

      When my son was almost 3 I left him to put something in our kitchen for literally less than 2 minutes when I heard the sound of running water.  As I ran to the room I found that my son had entered our bathroom and turned on our bathtub faucet and was falling into the tub when I grabbed him.

After making sure that he was ok, I couldn't  help but think "What if I would've arrived a minute or two later?"   

That experience and the thought of "what if..." has changed me and how I parent forever!  I learned that day that an accident can happen when we least expect.

 

Caring for our aging loved ones...

             


   In my later years, my wife and I became tasked with taking care of an aging love one.  This loved one of ours shared with us how one day she had been off her meds which caused crazy side effects.  Waking up one night and feeling confused she went to the bathroom to splash water in her face with hopes of getting her composure back.  While resting her hands in the sink she accidentally turned on the hot water instead of the cold, burning it severally with almost 2nd degree burns.  Thankfully, her neighbor was home to take her to the emergency room for care.  Little did I know that years later that talk would become part of my inspiration behind the Faucet Handle Safety Restraint.  

  With those two experiences in mind, I set out to do whatever I can to help prevent other families from having occurrences like what I had experienced.  Since that time I’ve heard similar accounts from other parents and care-givers which has fueled me and my wife to continue on this mission to educate care-givers about safe-guarding their homes and thus helping to prevent these occurrences.

...and the "FaucetLock" Faucet Handle Safety Restraint systems were born.

Scalds,  account for 33%--58% of all patients hospitalized for burns in the United States. Adults aged ≥65 years have a worse prognosis than younger patients after scald burns because of age-related factors and medical conditions.


              "DON'T LET YOUR LOVED ONE BE SCALDED BY HOT WATER!!!"


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need $50,000 to fund the restraints to manufacturing and full part production.  This will allow us to get aluminum or steel tools for Plastic injection molds, additional engineering services, distribution, packaging, UPC coding, pay for marketing, plus....
  • The restraints are ready for full scale production, but we need your help to reach a minimum volume needed to make production economically viable.
  • Aluminum tools will provide precise and quality parts in a mass scale.
  • Because its about the children, we want to focus on the item and not other gimmicks; and give contributors really good discounts on the restraints. 
  • Based upon a successful campaign having additional funding, we are ready to expand the safety restraint brand and start production with the Shower Safety Restraint.  Because small children have easier access to shower faucets than sinks, this is a needed companion to work with the sink restraint.

  • Your contributors will help you achieve product molds that will be made here in the USA, on a mass distribution scale.....


  • The Faucet Handle Safety Restraints system is patent pending.

    ***Some Illustrations may slightly differ but application is the same***



Fits Various Style Handles


Product Specs


The Impact

  • The Faucet Handle Safety Restraints system is a product that will help generations of children and aging seniors all around the world.  As long as small children have curious minds we and their is a senior population that needs care, there will be parents and care-givers need to be proactive in keeping them safe.
  • The Safety Restraints fulfills various benchmarks established by the American Academy of Pediatrics. 
  • There NO COMPETING in this space.  The "FaucetLock" Faucet Handle Safety Restraints system is a product that is needed & long over due...
  • Upon the success of this campaign we expect to launch its the companion, which is the SHOWER HANDLE FAUCET RESTRAINT.  For every $10,000 we reach the broader the series of restraints we can bring to market.



What People Are Saying...



@NurseMeTender            

"The faucet restraint Handles are a brilliant idea!"

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"All licensed childcare providers should be required to use this type of product in childcare facilities.  It would ease a parent's mind and prevent dangerous situations for children!"

"With the support of families and childcare programs, this product could     potentially alleviate the dangerous potential for young children being severely burned.

--Shani R., (Project Manager & Mom)

      --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"Keeping children safe is important because it only takes seconds for them  to get unintentionally hurt.  I'm glad SafeHolmes is leading the charge in
keeping homes safe for kids."

--Danielle F., (Graphic Designer & Mom)

       ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"There are products that make claims and then there are products that
exceed expectations.
For the money these are a great set of products.
--Doug G., (Industrial Designer & Dad)

       --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

" I love that you create products that help keep kids safe!"
--Tamara M., (Wife, Mom & R.N.)

      ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                      
        ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Risks & Challenges

We have worked very hard in the prototyping process to ensure we have a working product that is ready for manufacturing.  We are in final negotiations to select a larger volume manufacturing partner, and we need to set up the tooling.  Based upon all our previous prototyping and test manufacturing challenges are small, if any... If any issues arise, we are resolved to doing everything possible to get as close to our delivery date as possible and will keep a transparent dialogue with supporters so they can see the progress at each step.



    Why You Should Care...

                             


                                        


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
    • Please SHARE THIS using the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Keep us in your prayers!

              "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step" 


    "Thank You" For All Your Help!

    ...and standing with us & helping to bring our journey to life.

Your contributors will help you achieve product molds that will be made here in the USA, on a mass distribution scale.....The Faucet Handle Safety Restraints system is patent pending.    ***Some Illustrations may slightly differ but application is the same***
Fits Various Style Handles 

Product Specs
  The Impact
 
The Faucet Handle Safety Restraints system is a product that will help 
generations of children and aging seniors all around the world.  As long as small children
 have curious minds we and their is a senior population that needs care, there will be parents and care-givers need to be proactive 
in keeping them safe.
The Safety Restraints fulfills various benchmarks established by the American Academy of Pediatrics. 
There NO COMPETING in this space.  The "FaucetLock" Faucet Handle Safety Restraints system is a product that is needed & long over due...
Upon the success of this campaign we expect to launch its the companion, which is the SHOWER HANDLE FAUCET RESTRAINT.  For every $10,000 we reach the broader the series of restraints we can bring to market.
What People Are Saying...@NurseMeTender             "The faucet restraint Handles are a brilliant idea!"   ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"All licensed childcare providers should be required to use this type of product in childcare facilities.  It would ease a parent's mind and prevent dangerous situations for children!" 
"With the support of families and childcare programs, this product could     potentially alleviate the dangerous potential for young children being severely burned.
--Shani R., (Project Manager & Mom)      --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"Keeping children safe is important because it only takes seconds for them  to get unintentionally hurt.  I'm glad SafeHolmes is leading the charge in keeping homes safe for kids."--Danielle F., (Graphic Designer & Mom)       --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- "There are products that make claims and then there are products that exceed expectations.For the money these are a great set of products. --Doug G., (Industrial Designer & Dad)       ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  " I love that you create products that help keep kids safe!"--Tamara M., (Wife, Mom & R.N.)       ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                                               ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Risks & Challenges  We have worked very hard in the prototyping process to ensure we have a working product that is ready for manufacturing.  We are in final negotiations to select a larger volume manufacturing partner, and we need to set up the tooling.  Based upon all our previous prototyping and test manufacturing challenges are small, if any... If any issues arise, we are resolved to doing everything possible to get as close to our delivery date as possible and will keep a transparent dialogue with supporters so they can see the progress at each step. Why You Should Care...


                        



                                   

Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Please SHARE THIS using the Indiegogo share tools!
Keep us in your prayers!
            "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step" "Thank You" For All Your Help!...and standing with us & helping to bring our journey to life.

story:
READ the "WHAT IS IT" to fully understand!!

Are you a rider who enjoys using a visor when it's steamed up or scratched, and do you always remember to wear you reflective jacket? Do you even use one? 

Why not try EyeSkinZ to "Be Seen & See Clean" this winter!!

In 2013, Giles, a British engineer from the aerospace industry, and keen motorcyclist, set about addressing road safety for motorcyclists. He identified the inherent issue many riders have with visors and would like to encourage more people to use visors to protect their eyesight and view of the road.  

‘One has to look out for engineers - they begin with sewing machines and end up with the atomic bomb’ Marcel Pagnol

EyeSkinZ has the ability to improve road safety globally as volume orders decrease manufacturing costs. It offers a modern angle to reflective fashion, similar to that of Tron the film, with a high profile space for personalisation and branding whilst being a highly practical accessory.

So what is it:

EyeSkinZ is a water-resistant, washable cleaning protective cover for a visor which self stores into a pocket across the top of the visor. Made from high performance reflective materials it has three primary functions and a few of additional uses. 

1. It attaches to the top of any visor to offer an adjustable sun shade for the eyes. 

2. The high reflectivity glows during shoulder checks at night, as it reflects the headlights from other vehicles, increasing your conspicuity.

3. From an internal pouch deploys a super-thin and water-resistant microfibre protective cover for your visor, preventing it from damage when you are carrying a spare helmet or storing the one most commonly used. 

The protective cover doubles up as a visor cleaner and can be used to apply hydrophobic or anti fogging coatings. 

If you use an open face helmet then this cover can be used as a face protector, particulate filter, or a buff against cold or raining weather.

(PLEASE SEE ADDITIONAL IMAGES FOR OPEN FACE HELMET USERS)

"Be Seen & See Clean" - because that's what matters!!

Who is it for: 

This product is for the motorcycling community, the commuters, the touring groups, the cruisers and the speedsters!

Whether you just want a handy accessory to improve your road safety or to use it to unite your biking brothers and sisters, EyeSkinZ aims to bring people together by offering customisation and bespoke imagery. 

The position of the product on the helmet is ideal for advertising. This is particularly beneficial to delivery companies with low marketing budgets who can capitalise on this form of ‘on helmet advertising’ or the supporting garments like reflective wrist bands. 

Safety:

Prevention is certainly better than cure when it comes to an accident. There is no substitute for ensuring your visor is scratch free and clean as you head out onto the open road. 

Everyone who has trialled the product has been impressed with the benefits EyeSkinZ offers. From sun glare to light starring, anyone who has driven a vehicle knows of these issues. When you are on two wheels and combating variable weather conditions, there is little more you want than to "Be Seen and See Clean". 

For delivery business' looking to be safety conscious while promoting their brand, EyeSkinZ are a simple way of supporting your riders and preventing reoccurring visor replacement costs. 

Every year in the UK over 300 motorcyclists die on the roads, and 22,000 motorists "suffer severe injury". (Department for transport) 

"In 2009 the RAF lost more people to motorcycle accidents then it did in operation in Afghanistan." (Ministry of defence) 


What We Need 

£15k is what it takes to offer the best possible product to the market. 

Material costs are high and we want to offer the very best materials to the user.

I Giles Hugo have a vision, that with your support we can change the image of safety on the roads across the world, offering this sustainable solution to those that can't afford new visors whenever they get scratched, and can't afford lots of high visibility protective clothing. 

Please, support us now! With your drop in this ocean you can help me to create the waves that make this growing industry safer, whilst promoting care for your eyesight !!

We are offering a selection of exclusive EyeSkinZ for this campaign including the opportunity to have your logo and branding on the product.*

Don't miss out on supporting us and receiving your EyeSkinZ or branded mug as a thank you.  

Key points

  • Protect your visor from damage
  • Increase conspicuity
  • Keeps unwanted bright light out of your eyes (sun or street lights)
  • Easily transferred between all your helmets
  • Branding and advertising space 
  • Top quality water-resistant materials and easily washable at 40C.
  • Stylish and versatile
  • Customisable

EyeSkinZ Summary

EyeSkinZ is an affordable solution that will fit most flip front, open face or half face helmet visors. They protect your visor increasing your vision, guarding your eyes and caring for your eyesight whilst fashionably accessorising the look of your helmet. 


Detailed Overview:

Seeing the road

Visors are plastic and easily scratched when being stored between rides. Scratches, debris and muck can significantly impact the transparency of the plastic, leading to poor vision and water run off. 

Poor vision for the road makes bad riding conditions extremely dangerous. EyeSkinZ protects your visor so that you hardly notice its presence. The cover can also be used to apply hydrophobic and anti-fogging coatings on the go.

Managing sun glare

Eyes are sensitive to light. Because of ultra violet rays causing damage to the eyes we squint and get tired eyes when facing the sun. Simply by shading your eyes you can receive light with greater clarity and therefore see better. Whether the visor is in use or not EyeskinZ is adaptable to different sun shielding positions, helping to block out direct sunlight and allow better vision on the road.

Managing conspicuity 

The high quality fabrics used, reflect light from headlamps so that you are more visible at night. Because EyeSkinZ sits directly above your field of view it increases awareness of your intentions to other road users.


    The Impact

    My vision is to start a business with a clear focus and aim to improve the experience and safety for all road users globally and in doing so build a company based on innovation, high quality and the wellbeing of my employees and coworkers. 

    Find out more at 'www.Eyeskinz.co.uk' 

    Or follow us on FB or Twitter

    Thank you for your time and interest!

story:
After the greatest storm in recorded history ravaged a whole region of the Philippines...

The survivors of typhoon Haiyan are getting back on their feet. They are fighting to rebuild their homes, their families, their lives.

And according to them what they need the most are... jobs!

They need jobs to "help them help themselves" to fully recover from the tragedy that they went through. 

And that is what TACLOB is set on accomplishing.

TACLOB is a collective of artists, designers, social workers, and entrepreneurs that have partnered with survivors and businessmen in disaster zones to  establish a social enterprise dedicated in providing immediate jobs for disaster survivors.

As a first initiative we will be training survivors to make "eco-friendly" and "disaster resilient" bags that they themselves appreciate and the rest of the world would want to have.

Meet COMPASSION


COMPASSION is an iconic, bright red, 50% upcycled, weather-resistant backpack which is made of:

Pre-Loved Jeans

Hi-Grade Japanese Truck Tarpaulins

Genuine YKK Zippers

Military-Grade Nylon Thread for all Stitching

Stylish Leather Lash Tabs


We are assuring you that with all these intricate elements put into the making of this bag... COMPASSION will endure your lifestyle.

But aside from these details... what excites us about COMPASSION is the functionality of it's interior jeans lining/large pocket which can snugly fit a 13" Macbook or any standard folder.


Yes, this bag does not only look good but it is very functional and handy as well... but more importantly, COMPASSION is not just a bag... it's a badge!

Get COMPASSION.  Give COURAGE.

Yes, when you get a COMPASSION backpack you help in creating immediate  and much needed jobs for Haiyan survivors. But COMPASSION does not stop there...

For every COMPASSION bag that you get, we will give a Haiyan child survivor a  specially designed backpack that will  prepare them in case of an emergency like a tsunami, storm surge and tidal waves!

Meet COURAGE

COURAGE is a multi-functional survival backpack that will equip young children to float!!!

Masterfully designed by a team of bag makers and designers, this backpack utilizes 2 empty two-liter PET bottles strapped to the side of the bag to enable a child to float.

Constructed with high-density, water resistant nylon fabric, it is double stitched with military-grade nylon thread to ensure its longevity.  We've also included reflective striping on the front and back that enhances visibility at night, or in times of search and rescue operations.

Everyone we've introduced the COURAGE backpack to is very excited about the bag.  Especially the school officials, parents, and child survivors!

COURAGE not only gives them a fighting chance in any case of emergency, it also helps address a deep emotional trauma of uncertainty that is still haunting children to this day.

Watch the video below to see how this amazing survival backpack works.

How Did We Choose our Funding Goal

Our goal of $157,500 is based on the amount needed to:

-Purchase the optimized combination of industrial sewing equipment 

-Sign the lease on our reserved facility (in a typhoon/flood resilient area)

-Maintain a 6-month overhead budget

-Purchase the materials needed and pay a competitive salary to produce 2,500 COMPASSION backpacks for the world and 2,500 COURAGE backpacks for the children of Tacloban.  

Additionally we will work with our partner NGOs to provide workshops in crisis preparedness, climate change awareness, and psycho-social trauma mitigation.


What are Some of Our Key Funding Points

$6,000 –  Minimum amount required to purchase one of each industrial sewing equipment required to produce COMPASSION/COURAGE. 

$32,000 –  The optimal combination of industrial sewing equipment consisting of 24 High-Speed Industrial Sewing Machines, 8 Piping Machines, 1 Zigzag Machine, and 1 Bartacking Machine.  This combination of equipment allows for a scalable output of 64 COMPASSION/COURAGE backpacks made by 50 typhoon Haiyan survivors, per 8-hour shift. 

$70,000 –  A fully optimized industrial sewing factory spread over 250 square meters (2,700 square feet) and equipped with comfortable sewing stations, a materials management/inventory department, administrative cubicles, and 6-months of overhead budget.  Due to the word-class textile production capability we can even open the doors to subcontract the facility and trained employees to other manufacturers who would like to manufacture in a disaster resilient community.  Whether it is through manufacturing TACLOB products or another company’s, we know that we are able to provide livelihood for the Haiyan survivors.

$157,500 –  TACLOB has become a brand that is accepted by the global community.  From here forward, the sky is the limit!  

We have already been approached by various designers and businessmen who would like us to implement their ideas once we are setup.  Their ideas will become part of the TACLOB product line and will always adhere to three guiding principles:

  1.  To create jobs for the adults living in disaster zones by manufacturing products that the world wants

  2.   To utilize the proceeds of the global sales to manufacture products that a disaster community needs (i.e.  floating school backpacks, school supplies, and workshops)

  3.  To manufacture products that are either eco-friendly in design, or that address climate change issues.

As TACLOB's operational and sales efficiency increases, we become a scalable model that the world can use to rebuild any disaster zone.  

Natural Disasters can Happen to Anyone and Anywhere

It's time to work together towards a Disaster Resilient World... a global community that watches out for each other when disasters strike.  Get Compassion and show the world that you care...

not only about creating jobs in disaster zones... 

not only in helping children survivors...

but that you also believe that at this moment we must have each other's back!

Rest assured, 

#WeGotYourBack

story:
After spending some serious time in my studies and getting degree in technical background, Now i truly want to follow my heart and live the other dream of mine. I am super happy, that i got selected as a finalist for beauty pageant titled Miss Nepal USA 2012 and the next step of the proecss is to find get sponsor and raise $1000 dollars.

 

I would like to request to you all to help me to meet the goal so that i can participate in the event. Every small amount counts and you will be counted as a sponsor towards it. I dared to take a step with all positive hopes, and hope it all turns in good !!!!!

story:
WE HIT OUR GOAL!!! 

Thank you to EVERYONE for your support. For new purchases, please go to my website: www.ThePinkyPromise.com
THANKS AGAIN!!!!

The Pinky Promise: Eco-Friendly Jewelry with a social cause

Beautiful Jewelry - Good Karma

Thank you for your interest in the start of my new company. To my "new friends," my name is Brooke Hauser. I have always wanted to start a sustainable business that would have a social and environmental impact, while making a fair profit. My inspiration came from my background in art and design and working at a fair-trade wholesale company that worked with at-risk Artisans. My life changed when I went on a four month volunteer trip to Africa where I saw the big impact that a few dollars a day can make to the less fortunate of the world.

But I need your help to make this a reality...

       Please join me and be a part of this exciting venture

3 NEWLY ADDED PERKS!


NEW PERK A: "Twist and Shout (Girls)"

Pledge $20 or more...

...and you will receive 4 braided bracelets. 3 solid colored bracelets with recycled African metal beads and 1 multicolored bracelet decorated with a traditional Ethiopian metal trade bead. Color choices for the small, three bead bracelets are: pink, turquoise, olive green, orange, red, navy and black.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

NEW PERK B: "Twist and Shout (Guys)"

Pledge $25 or more...

...and you will receive 3 braided bracelets. 1 wide, 1 with a metal bar bead and 1 with a recycled African glass bead. 
Color choices:
wide braided bracelet: black/olive, navy/olive or red/olive
braided bracelet with metal bar: black, navy, red, or olive
braided bracelet with recycled glass: black/olive, navy/olive or red/olive

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

NEW PERK C: "A Bit Of Everything"

Pledge $95 or more...

...and you will receive a lavish necklace from Mali, decorated with beautiful traditional glass trading beads, cowrie shells and metal African adornments. Braided leather cord with loop closure. Guaranteed to get a second look from the hip, stylish crowd.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My campaign goal is $8,000. It is expensive to start a new company. The money that I am raising will help cover the set-up costs, both locally and in Mali, promotion, design, product development and the initial inventory. As a huge THANK YOU for your pledges, you will receive my new, stylish, eco-hip jewelry produced by a wonderful at-risk women's group in the African nation of Mali.


Tired of the same old "factory made" jewelry from China?  I am!

So get ready for my initial line of vibrant, eco-hip jewelry made from recycled materials and unique African beads.

After Indiegogo - The good karma and The Pinky Promise continues...

This is the start of something big! After the completion of this campaign, I will have a sustainable company with a distribution network from Mali. I will add local team members and start selling online and wholesale to retail stores. I will continue to add new, exciting product lines. Where do we go next? Stay tuned. I will continue to work with talented, at-risk Artisans and as my business grows, so will social impact. Wow, am I excited!

The design and product evolution- not Made in China

I was tired of the generic designs coming out of factory shops in China. I wanted to provide modern, vibrant jewelry that not only looks great, but also has a positive social impact. GOOD KARMA...Pass it on. While in Africa, I saw firsthand what beautiful creations can come from recycled and other materials.

When USAID introduced me to this women's group that was creating jewelry from colorful recycled flip-flops, recycled plastic bags and African beads, the light bulb switched on. Eureka!!!

My art experience at Arizona State University required me to create jewelry and art from recycled materials. This inspired my first line. The Malian women originally sent me recycled flip-flops that were melted down then molded into vibrant, round strings. I also received samples of recycled plastic bag colors and unique African beads. It was fun designing with different color combinations and accents.

What is The Pinky Promise?

My promise is to offer products that fit within my mission and business model of supplying unique, handmade products produced by at-risk individuals. With every business decision I make, the social and environmental impact will be considered - including a fair and sustainable wage for the producers.   

Perks:

Perk #1: "Early Funder Special #1"

Limited to 50 - Pledge $18 or more...

...and you will receive 10 beautiful Recycled Rubber Bracelets. In addition to the discounted price, you will also receive a FREE Recycled Rubber Ring.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In addition, you will receive any reward  #1 through #14. (If you want to use a special nickname, please submit it for prior approval.)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Social and Environmental Impact:

Social Impact:
An alarming percentage of the world goes to bed hungry and are forced to live on only a few dollars a day. With your support, we can provide economic support to the less fortunate by supplying them with work and improving their quality of life. Since most of the women Artisans work from their homes, they can care for their children while financially supporting their families.

Environmental Impact:
Recycling is cool; it's the new black. The majority of my jewelry is from recycled or upcycled materials, such as plastic bags and rubber flip-flop sandals. Every product has a carbon footprint and other environmental impacts. I will strive to minimize this impact in all aspects of my business. This includes packaging, shipping and the materials I use.

The Indiegogo campaign money will be used for:

It takes many resources and a lot of effort to launch an Indiegogo campaign and start a new business. I am also fortunate to have a close network of businesses and design mentors that assist me at a reasonable fee, or even free (thanks Mom and Dad!). If I do not reach the $8,000+ goal, you will still get 100% of your perks and I will reevaluate my growth plan.

You can make The Pinky Promise a reality!

Please consider making a pledge and spread the word to your friends and family by email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.

Statistically, the first three days of the campaign are crucial to gain momentum and to have a successful project. THEREFORE, PLEASE PLEDGE EARLY.

To quote Buzz Lightyear from Toy Story:
         Together let’s take The Pinky Promise “to infinity and beyond!”

FREE ADDITIONAL GIFTS FOR MY FUNDERS

If you post my project on your Facebook or Twitter, etc. and send 10 personal referral emails - to thank you, I will send you a FREE Recycled Rubber Ring and Recycled Rubber Bracelet with your order. To receive the free gifts, just write, I gave The Pinky Promise a Shout Out on the email that will be sent to you at the end of the project and I will add the extra free gifts to your order.

My Heartfelt Thanks - I couldn’t have done it without you!

  • To all my great funders- Thank you for believing
  • To Indiegogo for offering this awesome platform – Keep it up
  • To all my great friends who gave me advice and encouragement - you rock!
  • To Bob and Julie for your insightful business and design advice

Finally, a gigantic Thank You and shout out to my awesome photographer Jessica, my Papa, my gorgeous models and friends Dana, Missy, Laura, Julie, Ali, Erik, Ben, Evangely, Kareen, Irit and their adorable children. Finally, to Mom and Dad who have helped me every step of the way (your check is in the mail).

YOU ALL HELPED MAKE THIS A REALITY!

Pick Your Colors

You will choose your colors once the campaign is over. I will send you an email at the end of the campaign, where you will verify your shipping address and choose your colors. The recycled rubber bracelets are packaged in groups of five. For example, if you purchase 20 bracelets, then you can choose up to four different color groups. For the recycled plastic bag bracelets, please choose one of the color groups below.

*Please Note: Recycled Rubber Multi-Strand Statement Necklace, Recycled Rubber Dangle Earrings and Mali Wedding Glass Bead Necklace and Earrings are multi-colored, similar to the photos. The free Recycled Rubber Rings are also multi-colored, and sizes will vary. Since these products are all handmade with recycled materials, the color and sizes may vary slightly.


FAQ's

When do I choose my colors?
I will send you an email at the end of the project time period requesting your color choice(s).

Will the colors and designs exactly match the pictures?
Since these are all hand-made from recycled materials and by different Artisans, the color and design of the individual bracelets will vary. I will do my best to send you the closest match possible.

Is it possible to order different sized bracelets?
The bracelet sizes will vary slightly and are designed to "float" on you wrist for a comfortable fit and fashionable look. Because they are flexible, they will fit most wrists.  I will send you an email at the end of the project time period where you can indicate your preferred size range of S/M or M/L.  The men's bracelets will only come in one size.

Are your earring hooks hypoallergenic?
Yes. I personally attached the hooks in San Diego, CA with sensitive ears in mind. I want everyone to be able to enjoy my products!

What is the quality control of the products?
When we receive the products, we wash them and check the size and workmanship.

Can you pledge more than one perk?
Yes, you can...more good karma! However, you can only pledge one perk per transaction.

WE HIT OUR GOAL!!! 
Thank you to EVERYONE for your support. For new purchases, please go to my website: www.ThePinkyPromise.com


THANKS AGAIN!!!!

The Pinky Promise: Eco-Friendly Jewelry with a social causeBeautiful Jewelry - Good Karma

 Thank you for your interest in the start of my new company. To my "new friends," my name is Brooke Hauser. I have always wanted to start a sustainable business that would have a social and environmental impact, while making a fair profit. My inspiration came from my background in art and design and working at a fair-trade wholesale company that worked with at-risk Artisans. My life changed when I went on a four month volunteer trip to Africa where I saw the big impact that a few dollars a day can make to the less fortunate of the world.

But I need your help to make this a reality...
       Please join me and be a part of this exciting venture


3 NEWLY ADDED PERKS!
NEW PERK A: "Twist and Shout (Girls)"
Pledge $20 or more...


...and you will receive 4 braided bracelets. 3 solid colored bracelets with recycled African metal beads and 1 multicolored bracelet decorated with a traditional Ethiopian metal trade bead. Color choices for the small, three bead bracelets are: pink, turquoise, olive green, orange, red, navy and black.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NEW PERK B: "Twist and Shout (Guys)"
Pledge $25 or more...

...and you will receive 3 braided bracelets. 1 wide, 1 with a metal bar bead and 1 with a recycled African glass bead. Color choices:wide braided bracelet: black/olive, navy/olive or red/olivebraided bracelet with metal bar: black, navy, red, or olivebraided bracelet with recycled glass: black/olive, navy/olive or red/olive
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

NEW PERK C: "A Bit Of Everything"
Pledge $95 or more...


...and you will receive a lavish necklace from Mali, decorated with beautiful traditional glass trading beads, cowrie shells and metal African adornments. Braided leather cord with loop closure. Guaranteed to get a second look from the hip, stylish crowd.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
My campaign goal is $8,000. It is expensive to start a new company. The money that I am raising will help cover the set-up costs, both locally and in Mali, promotion, design, product development and the initial inventory. As a huge THANK YOU for your pledges, you will receive my new, stylish, eco-hip jewelry produced by a wonderful at-risk women's group in the African nation of Mali.

Tired of the same old "factory made" jewelry from China?  I am!
So get ready for my initial line of vibrant, eco-hip jewelry made from recycled materials and unique African beads.
After Indiegogo - The good karma and The Pinky Promise continues...
This is the start of something big! After the completion of this campaign, I will have a sustainable company with a distribution network from Mali. I will add local team members and start selling online and wholesale to retail stores. I will continue to add new, exciting product lines. Where do we go next? Stay tuned. I will continue to work with talented, at-risk Artisans and as my business grows, so will social impact. Wow, am I excited!
The design and product evolution- not Made in China 
I was tired of the generic designs coming out of factory shops in China. I wanted to provide modern, vibrant jewelry that not only looks great, but also has a positive social impact. GOOD KARMA...Pass it on. While in Africa, I saw firsthand what beautiful creations can come from recycled and other materials. 
When USAID introduced me to this women's group that was creating jewelry from colorful recycled flip-flops, recycled plastic bags and African beads, the light bulb switched on. Eureka!!! 

My art experience at Arizona State University required me to create jewelry and art from recycled materials. This inspired my first line. The Malian women originally sent me recycled flip-flops that were melted down then molded into vibrant, round strings. I also received samples of recycled plastic bag colors and unique African beads. It was fun designing with different color combinations and accents.
What is The Pinky Promise?

My promise is to offer products that fit within my mission and business model of supplying unique, handmade products produced by at-risk individuals. With every business decision I make, the social and environmental impact will be considered - including a fair and sustainable wage for the producers.

story:
Short Summary

We want people who are passionate about our product!

  • Hey Guys, My name is Shahram and these are KiwiCords.
  • I love my iPhone and I love great design, theirs some great cases on the market created with the same thoughtful design that apple put into their products. I wanted the same from my iPhone cable but i found their really wasnt any truely great alternatives on the market.
  • I began brainstorming ideas, what did I want from my charge cable? Strength and durability were a must, but i wanted it to look stylish and fun and be enjoyable to use. I became obsessed, searching for manufacturers and sketching designs after several samples I now have a working product im super proud of! I have a couple of hundred products that i have been selling at break even price.
  • Contribute to my campaign, support high quality well designed products.
  • Own your own KiwiCord Now!


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down:

  • We need you!
  • Contribute and be one of the first to own your own kiwi cord
  • We need the funds to manufacture the items in a large enough quantity to make this a viable business and carry on developing our new ideas in real life products.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • I feel their really is a huge gap in the market for these products, we use our smart phones more than ever, they become a part of our personalities, KiwiCords allows you to express this.
  • We arnt here for the short term, we have a sketch book crammed full of great ideas, we want to be around, supplying you guys with great accessories for a lifetime

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • We are going to run some giveaway competitions for some of our supporters who have helped spread the word via instagram, twitter and facebook.
  • If you like this product enough to help fund us or you think its a neat idea but not for you, please, for the click of a button share this project :)

And that’s all there is to it.

We want people who are passionate about our product!

Hey Guys, My name is Shahram and these are KiwiCords.
I love my iPhone and I love great design, theirs some great cases on the market created with the same thoughtful design that apple put into their products. I wanted the same from my iPhone cable but i found their really wasnt any truely great alternatives on the market.
I began brainstorming ideas, what did I want from my charge cable? Strength and durability were a must, but i wanted it to look stylish and fun and be enjoyable to use. I have a couple of hundred products that i have been selling at break even price.

story:
THE SHORT STORY:

I want to raise money for spinal cord research at Kennedy Kreiger Institute and for building new (and needed) ball fields at Key School.

Sports have always played an important part in my life.  I played varsity soccer and lacrosse in high school, lacrosse in college, have run in 3 marathons, competed in many road and mountain bike races, and recently competed in my first sprint and half-ironman triathlons.  Now I have turned my sights to my biggest challenge yet: a Full Ironman Triathlon: a 2.4 mile swim, followed by a 112 mile bike, and then a full 26.2 mile marathon distance run.  In celebration of my 50th birthday this year, will take on this beast, and fulfill a lifelong dream of completing an Ironman Triathlon in Cozumel, Mexico on December 1st.  

I need support to complete this race, but I know you're probably not going to fly to Cozumel to cheer me on in person (but really...why not?).  So here's how you can support me virtually--make a donation to my fundraiser!  Each donation will be like a little cheer in my head every time I need one.  And with a total of 140.6 miles to cover, I'll be needing those virtual cheers.

If that's not enough information for you, then by all means, keep on reading...

THE LONG STORY

No athlete is successful without a great coach.  I work with Coach Tom, an Ironman who has completed many triathlons, including several Ironman competitions.  Tragically,  while on a 100 mile training ride, Tom was hit by a car and is now a quadriplegic.  He continues to rehab at Kennedy Kreiger Institute in Baltimore, as well as act as a coach for endurance athletes.  One day, as research and treatment progress, he hopes to compete again.

I would like to raise money for The Spinal Cord Center at the Kennedy Kreiger Institute as a way to say thank you to Coach Tom, and with the hope that research will someday help Coach Toms and others with spinal cord injuries to be able to walk again.

Additionally, I have two daughters who attend The Key School in Annapolis.  This fabulous school unfortunetly does not have enough field space for all of the middle and upper school sports teams.  Students are bussed to neighboring fields for practice and games...the varsity baseball team travels in excess of one hour to play on their "home field".  The school recently purchased an old golf course just 2 miles down the road, and is in the process of raising money to start building 3 soccer feilds, a baseball diamond, and multiple tennis courts.  I am committed to giving half of any monies raised to the Key School athletic fields so that the time my youngest (Maya) enteres middle school, she can have home-team fields.  I have been coaching her soccer team this year, and have loved seeing that same athletic passion in her that I have myself.

For the past five months, I have been training about 20 hours per week.  Please join me in my journey and contribute to Kennedy Krieger and the Key School athletic fields.  At the end of this journey on December 1st, I hope to hear those magic words: "MICHAEL GLASS, YOU ARE AN IRONMAN!!

Kennedy Kreiger Institute as a way to say thank you to Coach Tom, and with the hope that research will someday help Coach Toms and others with spinal cord injuries to be able to walk again.Additionally, I have two daughters who attend The Key School in Annapolis.  This fabulous school unfortunetly does not have enough field space for all of the middle and upper school sports teams.  Students are bussed to neighboring fields for practice and games...the varsity baseball team travels in excess of one hour to play on their "home field".  The school recently purchased an old golf course just 2 miles down the road, and is in the process of raising money to start building 3 soccer feilds, a baseball diamond, and multiple tennis courts.  I am committed to giving half of any monies raised to the Key School athletic fields so that the time my youngest (Maya) enteres middle school, she can have home-team fields.  I have been coaching her soccer team this year, and have loved seeing that same athletic passion in her that I have myself.For the past five months, I have been training about 20 hours per week.  Please join me in my journey and contribute to Kennedy Krieger and the Key School athletic fields.  At the end of this journey on December 1st, I hope to hear those magic words: "MICHAEL GLASS, YOU ARE AN IRONMAN!!

story:
Shipping has commenced!

  • For all US orders, your package will arrive in 3-5 days after you place your order
  • International Orders please allow 10-15 days

 

Baobab Clothing Company was born out of our belief that people deserve better quality clothing.  National clothing brands are notorious for sacrificing quality to reduce their cost in order to make more money.  In fact, most national clothing companies use a tactic called attrition which focuses on how quickly a customer will return to replace and repurchase a product.   

 

Say goodbye to pesky buttons that fall off and go missing.

patent pending

We literally thought of everything, so you didn't have to think of anything

 

 

The Baobab Core Tenants:

 

The Baobab shirt was designed with a tailored fit.

story:
Short Summary

 p29:18 is a collection of outerwear for fashion-forward, driven, social butterflies who just happen to be plus size.  p29:18 is built on a commitment to fashion and respect of the consumer and community.

New designers have a catch 22 to overcome. Buyers from boutiques and department stores don't want  to invest in companies who don't have a proven track record. In short, you can't sell to them unless you have sold to someone else.  p29:18 wants to prove that this market is hungry for new designers and great design. Purchasing a coat through  our Indiegogo campaign will help p29:18 take our coats off the internet and bring them to local boutiques in your city

What We Need & What You Get

Starting a clothing line requires a lot of upfront cost. Traditional banks want to see a track record of sales before I can get funding to purchase fabric and get  the coats sewn in a factory. I need women sizes 14-24 to by this collection! 

If I presell 25 coats, I can make a deposit to order fabric. 

If I presell sell 50 coats, I can pay for my minimum order of fabric ( 1,000 yards!)

If I presell sell 75 coats, I can pay to have the coats sewn at our factory in Washington State, USA.

The Impact

Young professional plus-sized women are no longer accepting the small, matronly selections offered by popular department stores, and more turbulent seasonal weather is driving the demand for good outerwear. p29:18 is looking to fill this hole in the market; by pre-ordering a coat, you are communicating to the buyers, stylist, editors, and boutique owners that you want beautiful plus-size clothing in your city.

Risks & Challenges

p29:18 coats will be manufactured in the US based on orders received. The challenge of this philosophy is that, with no backstock on hand, there will be some wait time, after your purchase. A fully funded campaign will be shipped sooner than if we don't meet our goal, BUT IF YOU A BUY A COAT YOU WILL RECEIVE A COAT OR BE FULLY REFUNDED.

All throughout the campaign and the production, we will be very happy to keep you frequently updated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have a friend or loved one who would love a p29:18 coat? Share our campaign! We would also love to connect with you on Facebook (facebook.com/p2918brand) and Instagram (@p2918)
