story:
The Story Behind Tees That Feed

Althea Dyce was a youth at risk.  She grew up in toughest neighbourhoods of Toronto. Marginalized communities of negativity, fatherless children, gun violence, and substance abuse. If anyone faced adversity in their life, she has.   Through out the years, she's learned to overcome almost impossible circumstances, and tragedy. 

In spite of obstacles Althea has won awards from all over Toronto for her business plans and ideas: Recognition from Microskills Canda, City of Toronto, Spider Jones, and Humber College.  For years Althea has worked in the social community field working with youth and children programs.  She is well recognized for her hard work and commitment in the lives of many.  

Being inspired, she decided to change her career from working with children to Multi Media Design. Graduating as an overachiever in June 2012,  Althea thought entering the work force the second time would have been easier. However, in the past year and a half she’s been out of work and faced with even more hardship.   Althea faced eviction notices, which threatened her residency. She starred at homelessness many times.  Luckily, she had people around her who helped her with her rent and food. With no money, barely anything to eat she would cry herself to sleep some nights. Wondering when will the struggle be over.  It seemed as if no matter how hard she tried, and how much she proved herself, nothing would break.  

Mid 2013, Althea laid in her bed hungry, and frustrated.  Suddenly her heart grew fond a great idea that would change so many lives…She combined her experience working with children and youth, a desire to be a great entrepreneur, and her recent situation of going without decent meals, into one plan...To build a company that would share a message of hope by providing meals for those who need it most. Somehow, everything she went through began to all tie together.  She began to think about her situation, and the millions children around the world that have no help.  Althea’s belief is she was meant to go through struggle for a time as this. To relate to others, and be an effective business leader… Not only making profit, but more importantly making a difference in the world.  

She realized she had what it took to be a successful business leader. But what she needed was for the public to see her vision, and ideas…Talking to some of her professors at Humber College, they encouraged her that this business idea was great for Indiegogo. So, she took this new social innovation business idea to the next level…. Now on Indiegogo... is the beginning of Tees That Feed.


http://mediaservices.humber.ca/awards12/awards12-MSIT.html

http://www.humber.ca/vpacademic/content/testimonials

http://www.microskills.ca/spider-jones-youth-leadership-award-recipients/

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need a work area, branding (apparel, art work, website, labels, and packaging), and an informative website.
  • Our perks allow you to see your contributions, meals provided, and smiles you've helped create.  Nothing else feels better than to know you have made a difference in the world.  Get our start up movie!  Watch us move into our space! Watch us design new apparel, meet the founder and new team, up close and personal.
  • If we do not meet our goal, the plan is to start from the ground up.  We will use the money we have raised to make apparel at the lowest price we can afford. Provide as many meals as possible by selling our tees door to door. Continue to sell merchandise and continue build meal programs.   

The Impact

  • Give hope, and provide meals for children around the world. Many will be fed because you cared to see Tees That Seed get to their next start up stage.
  • Previously, Althea Dyce has ran city campaigns for youth groups and non for profit organization raising money for various causes. 
  • She's known to be a person full of love and a helping hand.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give monetary contributions? No problem. Here is how you can help.

  • Tell your friends, and family about Tees That Feed.  Like us on Facebook, and hashtag #teesthatfeed on twitter. Follow us and share our videos.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it. Thank you for your support.  You're awesome!

Our Promo Tees and Upcoming Apparel



Our Vision - Sustainable Meals for Children all over the world!

Promotional Material.  You can "Save As" and help us spread the word on Social Media if you'd like. 


More info:  Awal's Children of the Future Foundation

The Children of the Future Foundation (COTF), is a newly created not-for-profit organization focused on helping street children, orphans, and the needy in Ghana. Founded by Awal Alhassan (Possi Gee), the COTF Foundation is dedicated to raising money and making grants to charitable organizations which focus on improving and elevating the general welfare and well-being of the less fortunate, specifically children in unfortunate circumstances. In Ghana, many helpless children, over 33,000, can be seen wandering in the streets daily.

CONTACT DETAILS

A:  Awal's Children Of The Future Box 2710, Comm. 1 Tema - Ghana

T:  +233243661222 +233277247372

E:  childrenofthefuture2011@yahoo.com childrenofthefuture2011@gmail.com childrenofthefuture2011@hotmail.com

http://awalschildrenofthefuture.com/childrenofthefuture/

story:
Hi everyone! Here's my story.

I am the loving father of three children and i have been married for 15 years. I've been wanting to do this project for a long time and so i am asking you, the Indiegogo community, to fund to the Bald Brothers and Bald Sisters project. Keep in mind, if the Bald Brothers and Bald Sisters  project meets its goal and continues to be succesful, donations will be made to wounded soldiers fighting for our country.

How it happened.

I got inspired to make the Bald Brothers and Bald Sisters cartoons when my eldest daughter and I were spending some time together when I heard her cry. I looked back and saw that she was in pain. I asked her what was wrong and she told me she hurt her hand. Nothing i did seemed to cheer her up until i got the idea of drawing faces on her fingers. She started giggling immediately and that's when the idea came to me.

Where we're up to.

I did a 44 second commercial / motion picture just so I can bring these characters to life. As a small Company I am starting from the bottom  by doing merchandise first. I created a few car air fresheners and they came up beautifully, so this time I want to hit the beach with this gorgeous product... Flip flops, and lovely cartoons for all ages. This cartoon is made for males and females alike. The faces on the Bald Brothers characters show a variety of emotions. I wanted to give them unique character traits by having them show different facial features. From the big brother to the little one, and from the smart brother, to the slow one, each character has an original personality. Bald Sisters have faces that show more beauty and elegance.

How to order.

To make an order, you have to choose a specific gender and size number for the product.

This can be a beautiful gift for family and friends. Logos, designs,and the 44 second commercial are all TM, and Copyrighted.

 

These are one of the prototypes that I created before it was submitted to the manufacture for a review.

This is another picture of the prototype I created. Bald Sisters flip-flops.

This is my son Marko, with Bald Brothers prototype.

Another picture of the prototype.

This is the manufacturers visual design for the prototype.

This is the manufacturers visual design for the prototype. It shows a different strap.

This is my finished project, car air fresheners which I will send to each funder to show my gratitude for contributing.

 

This is my finished project, car air fresheners which I will send to each funder to show my gratitude for contributing.

 

 There is not much risk involved in this project.You wouldn't believe how motivated I am to do this project with you. I have done one project already, car air fresheners, so I am familiar with the production process. The only difference between car air fresheners and the flip-flops is that with the flip-flops, i have to do many moulds for different sizes. To finish a project, it takes 3 to 4 months. Production time varies due to the amount of orders made, freight time, and custom checking.

story:
How often do you find yourself in need of a website template, a photo, a graphic, a plugin, an audio or a video file for your project?

How often do you end up paying for one of these?

Wouldn't you agree that some things in life should be more accessible and free?

This is what we believed when we started creaTTor a year ago.

We embarked on a mission and invested our own time and money in developing a platform that will bring together creative people driven by the same vision.

 

 

We have already created a fast and reliable platform with a complex architecture that is capable of hosting and displaying multiple types of assets, each with different attributes and characteristics.

We have gathered together more than 100 "creattors" and over 5,000 free assets.

We developed a fast assets browsing tool with flexible category selection which will show the most relevant and popular files according to selected categories, search queries and filters.

We created a user accounts system and an admin interface to manage all the aspects of user uploads, file and account details.

Take a look around at www.creattor.com and see what we currently have to offer. 

Then imagine it taken to the next level ...

We need $200,000 to fund a creative team that will make creaTTor and its assets simply stunning.

We will add new creative categories to creaTTor, including: stock photos, audio & video loops and templates, code snippets, plugins and modules for mobile devices and Wordpress and other CMS's.

We will hire world class designers and developers to create awesome material that we will share for free for everyone to enjoy.

We will advertise on relevant websites to raise awareness, to persuade and motivate people to submit and share their creations for free.

We will launch creative contests.

We will create a blog with news regarding each creative industry and with a discussion forum.

Our ultimate goal, upon completion, is to have a platform where you can't tell the difference between creaTTor's most popular free assets, and the premium assets offered for sale by other established creative websites, in relation to the general style and quality of content.

 

We're a team of creative people who love design and technology. Each member may have different hobbies and unique skill sets, but everyone shares the same love.

In the past, we created www.FlashXML.net  and the most popular and flexible Flash components on the web, made in-house, when Flash was the main platform available for creating interactive web content.

We designed and created multiple websites, templates, plugins, graphic and video content. Most of our team members have extensive experience in the online industry, and many have also worked for major IT companies.

 

 

As with any project involving team work, management is the key to success.

Clear targets will be set and each of our team members will be focused on one or two particular tasks.

Our main numeric goal will be to create, bring and approve at least 100 new assets on creaTTor each day.

The quality is more important than numbers and we will concentrate on what we like best: creating beautiful content.

We will keep you posted on our blog with the evolution of our project each step of the way.

 

The most common question asked by professional web designers and developers is how would a website offering content created without a monetization goal could keep up with similar commercial websites in terms of quality, complexity and diversity?

Well, the first part of this achievement will result from this campaign. With the funds collected we will ensure that the quality of the uploaded content will be amongst the highest available.

Secondly, once creaTTor reaches a certain level of popularity, we are confident we will find resources to keep a world class team engaged in this continuously creative process, bringing fresh content to the website and adding innovative minds to our team on a regular basis.

This commitment comes from the fact that, as a team, we are the all time top-selling producers of Flash components. Our team will have surpassed, not only in sales and popularity, but also in complexity and quality of content other authors from websites with a more diverse content. This simply goes to show that a well-organized team can deliver better results in a highly competitive industry.

And, most importantly, we will be backed by an open community. Amazing things happen when people from all over the world work together.

 

We take copyright infringement seriously, allowing only original and properly licensed work to be uploaded to our website. We will display and respect any license terms and distribution rights of each and every individual author.

Most of the files on creaTTor are under a creative commons license which basically means they are all free for personal and many times commercial use.

Everything our team creates will be MIT licensed, which is the most permissible open source license out there. It means you can do whatever you want and choose whatever license you want when you build something with our files.

 

Please click here for a detailed explanation of our rewards.

In short, depending on your level of financial contribution, the following perks may be available to you:

1. Licenses for FlashXML products (www.flashxml.net)
2. Badges next to your name on creaTTor site
3. Exposure for your name and/or brand on creaTTor
4. Access to download files before they are published on creaTTor
5. Exclusive access to creaTTor's task management system
6. Have your logo & link on every page of our website and newsletters for one year (limited)

Don't forget to read how the perks are explained in detail.

We will give you a Personal License for a FlashXML product of your choice if you share and tweet about our campaign.

Note: You don't have to wait until the end of the campaign in order to get your FlashXML license. You can claim it straight away by sending us an email to contactcreattor.com




If you cannot contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help.

Become a creaTTor and share your files with the world!

Give us a suggestion, share your ideas. It's all about creativeness and the freedom to be creative.

Spread the word about this campaign. Tweet it, Like it, Share it!

Every little bit of help matters a lot!
story_txt:
How often do you find yourself in need of a website template, a photo, a graphic, a plugin, an audio or a video file for your project?
How often do you end up paying for one of these?
Wouldn't you agree that some things in life should be more accessible and free?
This is what we believed when we started creaTTor a year ago.
We embarked on a mission and invested our own time and money in developing a platform that will bring together creative people driven by the same vision.
 

 

We have already created a fast and reliable platform with a complex architecture that is capable of hosting and displaying multiple types of assets, each with different attributes and characteristics.
We have gathered together more than 100 "creattors" and over 5,000 free assets.
We developed a fast assets browsing tool with flexible category selection which will show the most relevant and popular files according to selected categories, search queries and filters.
We created a user accounts system and an admin interface to manage all the aspects of user uploads, file and account details.
Take a look around at www.creattor.com and see what we currently have to offer. 
Then imagine it taken to the next level ...

We need $200,000 to fund a creative team that will make creaTTor and its assets simply stunning.

story:
Hello, my name is TJ Byerson. I am a 25 year old man from New York City currently living in Baltimore, Maryland. While I am new to this form of fundraising, I am excited to share with you a little bit about myself and what I am doing.

As a member of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Incorporated, I have come to learn the pride in representing an organization that means so much to me as it does to my fellow fraternity brothers as well as the men and women of other Black Greek-Lettered Organizations through paraphernalia (shirts, hats, sweaters, etc.). However, many of the looks of the apparel available didn’t always appeal to my personal sense of style. After discussing my frustration with fellow fraternity and sorority members, I learned I wasn’t alone. It was from that a spark occurred within me. Why couldn’t there be apparel that has both mass appeal as well as fit into the Greek life niche?

It is from that spark that Unconquerable Soul was born. A line that serves both Greeks and non-Greeks alike. I am taking the leap and putting my hat in the ring to provide a unique take on apparel. But this idea born into a brand is still in its infancy, and is for that reason that I am asking for the support of those who believe in me, my idea and my passion. Helping me launch this effort will allow me to see this effort through to the end, make a difference and most importantly, demonstrate that chasing dreams are possible when you’ve got drive, ambition and support.

story:
n.

    Here is my Production Time Line~

    March~  Launch Campaign.

    April~  Expected funds received. 

    Order Supplies, Materials, ZEBS, Zooney ShortBudz, T-Shirts, Bandanas, Caps, Visors and Hooded Sweatshirts.

    May~  Received Supplies and Materials.  Receive Bandanas, Caps, Visors and Sweatshirts.  Send Bandanas to Tailor.

    June~  Receive ZooneyWear T-Shirts.  Receive ZEBS and ShortBudz.  Send Caps, Visors and Sweatshirts along with ZEBS to Tailor. 

    July~  Receive Zooney Bandanas from Tailor and have laborers insert ShortBudz, package and prepare them for  shipping.  Receive i-Caps and Zooney Visors from Tailor and have Laborers package and prepare them for shipping.

    August~  Receive Zooney Hoodies from Tailor and have Laborers package and prepare them for shipping.

    September~  Sort, Package and Ship all Perks to Indiegogo backers.

    Issues and Challenges~

    One of the issues I'm working on is the loss of clarity the naturally happens when using an extension for music or sound.  In reality, that is just what the ZEBS are...an extension.  I noticed a loss of about 5% in the quality of sound between the ZEBS and the Zooney ShortBudz.  To remedy this issue, I'm looking to using a thicker wire for the ear buds along with a upgraded speaker system.  But dollar for dollar, the ZEBS still sound as good or even better then it's price comparison. 

    My first foreseen challenge would most likely come at the end of this Summer.  This is when ZooneyWear.com, our online store will be expecting a heavy load of orders for our first Holiday Shopping Season and at the same time trying to fulfill our commitment to our Indiegogo backers.  Of course our 'Backers' will come first.  Smile....

story:
About Ohana

We are Emily and Luke Dudley, the owners of Ohana.  Influenced by the mountains, the beach and adventure. Together we design and screen print apparel, home goods and other fun stuff.  And we do it all right here in the amazing and beautiful town of Steamboat Springs, Colorado. 

We are opening a retail shop, launching a website and going after our dream. So far we have been funding ourselves and working on a shoestring budget, but need some help in order to share our goods with the world, or at least a few more people.

What We Need - Your Help!

We have reached our goal of $3,500, which is amazing,  but we still need your help. Any extra money we receive will be invested right back into the business to help us buy more start-up inventory, fill our extremely empty retail space or maybe even help us sign a longer term lease! 

What You Get 

  • To be the first people wearing Ohana gear or showing it off in your house
  • A  killer deal on a gift certificate for our pop-up shop this winter
  • Maybe even an invite to our grand opening party
  • And a really warm feeling in your heart
  • See perk description on the side or below for full pictures and descriptions of our perks

Risks & Challenges

We know opening a business isn't easy, and there are risks involved, we have tried to minimize the risks by:

  • Starting with a pop-up shop, without a long-term lease we don't have long-term risk
  • Taking second jobs to pay the bills
  • Being crafty, new stuff is expensive, so most of our equipment is hand made from the re-store, other people's junk is our treasure, and it is also awesome for the environment

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't see something you like please share this campaign with someone who might.  Or stop by our shop at 700 Yampa Avenue, Steamboat Springs, CO (opening December 1st) or our website www.mtnohana.com (which will launch sometime in December)

Indiegogo makes it easy to share this campaign, one simple click could help our dream become a reality!  


Perks - Here are the options

If you see something you like, you can contribute by clicking on the corresponding "perk" on the right side of the page.  If the perk you select has options, or requires sizing, we will reach out to you prior to the funding date to collect that information. Thanks.

T-shirt : $23

The world's most comfortable t-shirt (as tested by Ohana) with Emily's hand drawn "Mountain Wave" design.  The t-shirt comes in royal blue with a slight heather, and is 65% polyester and 35% cotton, making for an extremely soft and lightweight feel.


Women’s T or Tank: $23

Your choice of racerback tank top or women's specific t-shirt, both are super comfy with flattering cuts, featuring our signature "Mountain Ohana" design.  The racerback comes in vintage purple and is 50% polyester, 25% cotton and 25% rayon. The t-shirt comes in dark grey and is  50% polyester, 25% cotton and 25% rayon for a very soft and lightweight feel.


Youth Package: $40

Two awesome youth shirts.  One grey t-shirt featuring our "Mountain Ohana" design and a super cute black and white baseball tee featuring our "Elevate" design. Available in sizes 6 to 12 months, 12 to 18 months, 18 to 24 months, 2T,4T, 6T:


Sweatshirt + Tote: $50

A dark grey lightweight, zip up, hooded sweatshirt with our "Elevate" design on the back, and a little Ohana love on the front.  Perfect for just about any occasion,  but here a couple places we envision it being worn: around a campfire, the perfect spring ski day or for extra protection when you reach your destination.  And we are going to throw in a tote, for walking around in style, shopping, storing stuff or whatever pleases your soul.  Sweatshirt is 50% cotton, 25% polyester, and 25% rayon.

Women’s Sweatshirt + Tote : $50

A grey lightweight, zip up, hooded sweatshirt with a hand-drawn aspen tree on the back and falling aspen leaves on the front.  A perfect blend of function and style. And we are going to throw in a tote, for walking around in style, shopping, storing stuff or whatever pleases your soul.  Sweatshirt is 50% cotton, 25% polyester, and 25% rayon.


Home Goods Package : $60

Add a little flair to your home with our Home Goods Package.  Featuring three unique tea towels (one with pine trees, one with aspen trees, and one with aspen leaves).  A 20" x 20" throw pillow cover with our classic "Mountain Bear" design.  And our premium lined canvas tote bag, with snap, perfect for shopping or as an accessory.  PLEASE NOTE the throw pillow is the cover only, it is not economically viable to ship the pillow portion, the pillow portion can be found at most department stores.


The Ohana Package : $100

The perfect combo, including our "Mountain Wave" t-shirt in blue, our "Elevate" sweatshirt in dark grey, our "Pine" hat, and a premium lined tote with snap closure to accessorize it with.  Were only missing the pants, you have to supply those yourself.  PLUS an invitation to our Ohana grand opening party, with awesome drinks, snacks and deals (tentatively scheduled for Dec 4th, 2015)


The Women’s Ohana Package: $100

The perfect combo, including our "Mountain Ohana" t-shirt or tank, our "Falling Aspens" sweatshirt in grey, our "Snowflake" hat, and our premium lined tote with snap closure to accessorize it with.  PLEASE note the women's hat is a "youth-size" hat with a slightly shorter brim, we find these hats to be better fitting and sleeker than the common uni-sex hats.  PLUS an invitation to our Ohana grand opening party, with awesome drinks, snacks and deals (tentatively planned for Dec. 4. 2015)


The Apparel + Home Goods Megapackage - $150

Save $10 by getting it all. The megapackage combines the home goods package and our Ohana (or Women's Ohana) package. So you will get: a t-shirt(or tank), a sweatshirt, a hat, 3 tea towels, a throw pillow cover, and 2 totes (1 standard tote and 1 premium lined tote with snap closure).  PLUS an invitation to our Ohana grand opening party, with awesome drinks, snacks and deals (tentatively scheduled for Dec 4th, 2015)


$110 Gift Certificate - $100

Like more options or seeing the goods first? Maybe a gift certificate is for you.  Pay $100, and get a $110 gift certificate.  Gift certificates will be valid from December 1, 2015 to March 31, 2016, at our Ohana Pop-up shop located at 700 Yampa Avenue in Steamboat Springs, CO.  Only 20 available. 

The PERFECT Christmas present!


The Ultimate T-shirt Package - $500

20 T-shirts with your own design on them. Work directly with Emily to design your t-shirts and then we will print them for you.  We will help you find the perfect t-shirt /tanks or baseball t's (no crappy uncomfortable shirts here). 

Perfect for your business, a bachelor/ette party or family reunion. 

All the shirts have to have the same design, but can come in different sizes, colors or styles.  Design limited to 1 color.


Did you see something you like, if so, you can contribute by clicking on the corresponding "perk" on the right side of the page.  Thanks and Aloha. 

Luke and Emily Dudley
Ohana

story:
The first fully telescopic umbrella with an automotive inspired rib suspension system and interchangeable canvas

About this project

Broken umbrellas are a common sight following every heavy rainfall. These umbrellas are all built with thin skeletal frames and weak hinged joints, easily susceptible to wind damage. Want an umbrella that lasts? The answer is here!

"...may be the last and best umbrella you'll ever own" -Gizmag

"Finally, an umbrella that’s as tough as you are " - Digital Trends

"...the 'Incredible Hulk' of the umbrella universe" -Huffington Post

'"The Cypress Umbrella gets right to the heart of one of the umbrella’s fundamental flaws" - 3DPrint.com



Telescopic Architecture - The Cypress features an industry first: a fully telescopic frame architecture which combines a traditional collapsible stem with an innovative telescopic rib design. Rather than a standard skeleton with U-shaped channels and hinged linkages, each rib is comprised of tubular sections coupled with precision machined joints and stainless steel pins.

Once opened, the telescopic design enforces a rigid structure 10 times stronger than traditional counterparts.


Independent Suspension System - The Cypress Umbrella features an automotive-inspired suspension system to combat against chaotic winds. Similar to how the shocks on your car work to provide an overall smoother ride, each rib within the Cypress Umbrella's architecture is designed to pivot and adjust independently.


These independent movements allow the Cypress Umbrella to handle sudden shifts in airflow about the canvas, making it more aerodynamically stable.


Interchangeable Canvas - Quick snap connections along the ribs enable a limitless selection of canvas colours and patterns.


In under 3 minutes, the Cypress Umbrella's canvas can transform to accommodate any mood, dress or perspective of the day.

Embedded Enclosure - To ensure the umbrella can be easily stored without getting your belongings wet, concealed within the handle is a deployable enclosure.

The Cypress Umbrella's expanding sleeve promises drip-free protection and is guaranteed to never go missing.

Simplicity and intuitive design are key, and in 3 easy steps the Cypress Umbrella goes from portable to fully open.


First, the enclosure slides on and off effortlessly into the handle. Next, the skeleton expands with a pull of a latch, the stem and ribs locking into place. Finally, extending the manual slider opens the umbrella, putting the canopy in tension.

Also available will be the Cypress Umbrella Classic, a full-length umbrella with wider coverage, the same Independent Suspension System, and interchangeable canvases.

Similarly, the Cypress Umbrella Classic will be constructed with the same build quality, providing optimal durability and lengthy service life to all its owners.

Cypress Umbrella


Cypress Umbrella Classic

There will be 10 initial colours and patterns offered. A survey will be sent to all backers once the campaign has ended on choice of canvases. Additional colours and patterns will available in the future.


Hailing from the west coast of Canada, in the rainy city of Vancouver, our story began with the ambition to develop the smallest, most portable everyday umbrella while retaining strength. Ideally, a product small enough to fit in a jacket pocket, yet sturdy enough to last season after season. However, this proved to be more troublesome than we imagined. Umbrellas haven’t really changed at all for the past century. The mechanisms still remain the same in how they’re built and how they operate. There were tweaks here and there, whether changing the profile of the members or changing the materials to improve size and strength. After countless weeks of trying to design a smaller umbrella to compete with others, we started realizing why small umbrellas were all constructed the same: every shortcut is taken to reduce that final size and weight. If we were to compromise strength for size, it would be yet another product with a short life span. So we decided that while we can’t make the smallest umbrella, we can most definitely make the strongest and most durable umbrella.


We listed every feature that we liked amongst current umbrellas and everything we would want in ours. Working out of the Vancouver Hack Space, we had to redesign almost every component. Going back to basic engineering principles and leveraging new innovative processes, we defined we a new architecture, new mechanisms and improved product life. In the end, aside from making the strongest umbrella, we believe we have created the most versatile umbrella. An umbrella with a fully telescopic architecture, interchangeable canvas capability, an Independent Suspension System and finally a drip-free concealed handle enclosure.

The past 10 months has been an endless cycle of design ? fabricate ? test ? break ? repeat. The result is the refined prototype you see now. Our goal in the next 10 months is to make sure the umbrella is in your hands.

Cahay Ho, born and raised in Edmonton, Alberta, is a Mechanical Engineering graduate out of the University of Alberta. Throughout his studies, Cahay was heavily involved with the Formula SAE race car, the experience that sparked the idea behind the Cypress Umbrella’s Independent Suspension System. In the workplace, he is a product design engineer, constantly creating innovative solutions across multiple sectors from automotive to biomedical. 

Kevin Truong, from Toronto, Ontario, is a Mechanical Engineering graduate from the University of Waterloo. A natural problem solver, Kevin’s jack-of-all-trades skill set is especially useful during time-critical situations. He brings a wealth of experience from automotive and aerospace sectors through his work for GM and Daimler as well as multiple Tier 1 suppliers. 

We want to thank a lot of people and organizations for helping us get this far. For all their work with the campaign page, media credit goes to:

Videography: Alex Bocajj + Crew (bocajj)
Photography: Linda Liu

Another big thanks goes to: Mark Lee / Jason Van / Kumiko Aoki / Clement Woo / Kerri Mak / Members of VHS / Dan Royer (marginallyclever) / Ashish Bidadi (Palette) / Viktor (ForeverSpin) / Glen Dobson (Mac-Ride) / Leor Grebler (Ubi) 

Finally, we would like to thank all those taking the time to look at our project — we appreciate your support, feedback and helping us turn this into a reality

Risks and challenges

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: As we optimize the assembly for production, there will likely be some minor changes. The Cypress Umbrella is a well-defined and working prototype, but there's more to perfect. Improvements are planned for the handle, enclosure and top hub components to improve aesthetic appeal and make it even more user-friendly. The Cypress Umbrella is currently compromised largely of 3D printed parts alongside our precision machined components. These 3D printed parts will translate into production intent materials and manufacturing processes. Just imagine how strong the umbrella will become when our 3D printed parts are constructed from aluminum and injection molded plastic! All changes will only be of benefit to you, and of course we will always keep you informed of any modifications and advancements.

MANUFACTURING: Together, we have over 15 years of experience in the automotive sector dealing with suppliers and manufacturing. We will only be working with suppliers with experience in providing high quality components ensuring your Cypress Umbrella is built to last.

FULFILLMENT: We will do our best to meet our delivery goals. As this product is so new and unique, there is a high chance that we'll encounter obstacles along our way. However, we can ensure you that we will not take shortcuts or accept poor quality components while creating your Cypress Umbrella. So please be patient with us as we bring you the last (and best) umbrella that you will ever buy!
story_txt:

story:
Who are we?

D.I.D. Nail Paint is an eco-friendly, highly pigmented nail color collection that achieves full coverage on the nail in 1 - 2 coats. 

 

 

Adrienne Blanks is the creative mind behind the nail color collection D.I.D. Nail Paint. A licensed nail technician, esthetician, and nail art enthusiast, Adrienne designed this product with creative expression in mind.

 

Allow me to introduce you to our colors:

Free Spirit



Fancy

Honey Child

Billie's Jeans

The four colors in our premier collection are bright and bold - now it's time to take things up a notch and create a new collection. But first, we want to tell you how D.I.D. Nail Paint can change the world we live in and why we need your help...

How we will change the world:

Since we launched in 2011, we have donated our time to churches, and non profit organizations like the Boys and Girls Club and The Star Boutique by giving young girls in underserved communities the opportunity to have a day of pampering and self esteem building. 

We are raising money to grow our collection and develop new colors. Not only do we want to continue to make beautiful, bold colors, we want to continue help out the community by financially supporting non profit organizations that we believe in.

With our new collection, we will donate a percentage of the sales to charitable organizations that support underserved communities and women who have been victimized by sexual violence. We will work with more organizations as we continue to grow. 

Why we need you:

The funds that you donate will help us mass produce our new collection, give our website a facelift, develop sustainable, eco-responsible packaging and establish a physical presence with a D.I.D. Nail Paint showroom so that all can have an official place to get their nails D.I.D.

And, in return, you get special rewards as a big huge 'THANK YOU" for your support!

Other ways you can help:

No money? No Problem! 

You too can become an official Get Your Nails D.I.D. supporter by telling everyone you know about our campaign. Email, Facebook, Instagram, or Tweet our link to your friends and loved ones. 

Let people know how cool you are because you support an emerging nail color collection that is eco-friendly, highly pigmented and achieves full coverage on the nail in 1 - 2 coats (You can say it just like that).

story:
At Georgie we know that your day doesn't stop being active once your workout ends. We design clothes to be worn before or after a workout. We wanted to create clothes for athletic women like us, who want a quick change, that still leaves them feeling stylish and comfortable. 

We're offering this limited edition onetime only wholesale price production run on Indiegogo and we're asking for your help to bring Georgie Wear clothes to strong, athletic and fashionable women everywhere. 

AFTER CAMPAIGN ENDS, YOU WILL BE CONTACTED FOR YOUR SIZE. 

 

 


$35 or more THE KNEE LENGTH UPTOWN SKIRT. This skirt will take you from straight from workout to work, looking your best. Available in Charcoal Heather Grey.

$40 or more THE MID CALF UPTOWN SKIRT. This skirt will take you from straight from workout to work, looking your best. Available in Black.

$45 or more THE DOWNTOWN DRESS. Look stylish wearing this sporty dress post workout or on race day. Available in Purple with Black mesh detail.

$65 or more THE UPTOWN DRESS. Look sophisticated and strong in this classic dress. Available in Black or Purple.

 We've been developing Georgie over the past year and a half. It began with our search for the perfect active wear fabric that will wick moisture to keep us cool, have the right amount of stretch allowing us to move freely and still look fashionable and stylish.

 After we sourced our fabric, we started working with local pattern and sample makers with over 30 years of industry experience, and ultimately we teamed with a production facility in Austin, TX that are known for their high level of detail and craftsmanship. We are proud to work with a local factory and offer you beautiful dresses and skirts that are made in the USA.

 We've done all the leg work, and with your support and pledges through pre-orders of our first collection we can begin production right away.

Georgie Wear was launched in 2014 as a collaboration between two artists, athletes and life long friends, Danielle Hatch and Meikel Reece. Our love of sports began in school as co-captains of our high school volleyball team. Danielle went on to study architecture and sculpture, where her background in sewing came in handy as she created a 10' tall Victorian dress for her masters thesis at UC-Santa Barbara. Meikel studied photography and established her freelance photography business, while also working in the fashion industry as a buyer and  retail manager. 

As we both transitioned into our careers in the arts and motherhood, we found ourselves, like so many women, spending the entire day in our workout clothes. We loved the comfort and ease of these clothes but didn't always feel fashionable going out to dinner in our yoga pants and running shorts. Georgie Wear was inspired by our desire to bridge the divide between our active wear and casual wear. We wanted to create athletic inspired pieces that can take you quickly from your workout to the rest of your day without wasting time or sacrificing style.

story:
About the hemisphere lamps

Dear Contributors, thank you for your interest and for reading these lines.

I started this project because I moved to a new flat and wanted to buy lamps for the rooms. After running to several shops I can tell you: lamps are really expensive. So I decided to make a lamp myself. You can see the prototype in the picture above.

It would be great for me to help other people who don't have enough money to buy expensive lamps, with their lighting situations. In my online shop (read about it later) you can decide which color each lamp should be and so you can get a unique designed piece at a low price.

Please help me to bring some light into the world!

What I Need & What You Get

As you can see this is only a prototype to prove that it's not a fake. I need some more things to make those lamps more professional and to sell them to everyone in the world.

First of all I need some good tools like a professional milling machine (like this one: http://img4web.com/view/XSLJK2), a workbench, tools for painting, and other tools. Then I need better materials (silicon coated wires, better sockets for the lamps, ...).

With these tools and materials I can produce the lamps and sell them to my customers. For doing that I need a website with a shop - I'm no web designer and I need someone who sets it up for me.

That's why I need those funds and I hope I can reach my goal.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Just tell your family, classmates, friends, husband, wife,... about my campaign. :-)

Thank you!

story:
Hi there, Indiegogo!

I'm Zihao, and along with my friend Rob we are working on bringing wooden sunglasses to you this summer, through our project Canopy Sunglasses!

Not only are we trying to do something different in the world of sunglasses, we're also doing our bit for the planet by planting a tree for every pair that we ship. 

We've already made a handful of prototypes and are looking for funding to ramp up production. We would be honoured if you would be part of our journey.

Something different

So what are we talking about when we say "something different"? Surely there's enough variety in the market already?

Not sure if you know, but the global sunglasses industry is largely under the control of one company. Luxottica.

These guys are EVERYWHERE. They own Ray-Ban, Persol, Oakley, Oliver Peoples and Vogue, just to name a few. They are also the guys that make the sunglasses branded under Armani, Bulgari, Chanel, D&G, DKNY, Ralph Lauren, Prada, Versace - you name it! In addition to all these brands, they also own Sunglass Hut, LensCrafters, ICON, Cole Vision Care among a whole host of other subsidiaries. All this made them more than seven billion Euros in 2012. More than seven billion.

So essentially you've got a single company offering you "choice" between its "competing" brands. All that's happened is the prices have gone up and up. Find out more.

With Canopies we're trying to break the mould. Rob and I are just two guys in London who are trying to make a bit of a splash. With us, you get a pair of exquisite hand-made wooden sunglasses that features a unique wooden grain, with none of the brand inflation to pay for the glossy billboard advertising. 

 

Canopies

With this Indiegogo project we're trying to launch our first line of Canopies. We're keeping it simple right now. Two classic styles in a number of different types of wood for you to choose from. The lenses are also premium polarising lenses that offer full UV protection. Each pair is hand made and inspected to ensure quality is top notch. We've been wearing them for a while now and genuinely love them.  If this goes well, we've got many ideas up our sleeves for future models! Please do pledge your support - check out our rewards on the right!

 

Sustainability

We built Canopy with more in mind than just cool summer styles. We're convinced that responsible businesses can do a lot of good in the wider community, too. Desertification is one of the biggest challenges facing the planet today. We're not experts on the topic, but Allan Savory is. With every pair of Canopies you buy, you're not only supporting responsibly-sourced wood production, but also contributing to the fight against desertification.

For each pair of Canopies, we will be planting a tree in the Koulikoro region of Mali - an area that faces increasing desertification, terrible soil erosion and destruction of animal habitats. The trees planted not only reforest the area, they also act as windbreaks which protect fields and fights soil erosion.

 

Thank You!

Big thank you for taking the time to check us out - we hope you're as excited as we are about this project, and look forward to sending a pair of Canopies your way! Please also share with all your friends!

If you have any questions please get in touch! 

Cheers!

Zihao & Rob

The lenses are also premium polarising lenses that offer full UV protection. Each pair is hand made and inspected to ensure quality is top notch. We've been wearing them for a while now and genuinely love them.  If this goes well, we've got many ideas up our sleeves for future models! Please do pledge your support - check out our rewards on the right!
 



Sustainability

We built Canopy with more in mind than just cool summer styles. We're convinced that responsible businesses can do a lot of good in the wider community, too. Desertification is one of the biggest challenges facing the planet today. We're not experts on the topic, but Allan Savory is. With every pair of Canopies you buy, you're not only supporting responsibly-sourced wood production, but also contributing to the fight against desertification.
For each pair of Canopies, we will be planting a tree in the Koulikoro region of Mali - an area that faces increasing desertification, terrible soil erosion and destruction of animal habitats. The trees planted not only reforest the area, they also act as windbreaks which protect fields and fights soil erosion.
